sense.name: stake money or something of value on the outcome of an issue
sense.commentary: Includes: BET ON NOTE: this may be interpreted as a subset of sense 2; if money is involved this sense should be chosen (naturally, the better may often feel certain that what they are betting on is true or will occur) NOTE: this is only if money or valuable item is wagered or gambled
sense.examples: I bet you $10 you can't lift that rock. He regularly goes to the races and bets heavily. I bet you my blue marble that I'll get there before you. I'm betting on the new horse.

sense.name: express certainty (or take action on the assumption) that something is true
sense.commentary: No gambling is implied. No money or goods are wagered. The subject is usually (but not always) in 1st person.
sense.examples: I bet she's missed the bus. I bet (you) that he won't come. I bet he's forgotten to bring the keys. You bet!
